definition: great despite minor blemishes/a rough diamond
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
alcohol/wine with high alcohol content/rich/pure/good wine/sterols
to transform gold into base metal (idiom); fig. to edit sb else's beautiful prose and ruin it
facing a wall, an imaginary construction (idiom); baseless fabrication
differing only slightly/not much between them
a thousand tries leads to one success (idiom, humble expr.); Even without any notable ability on my part, I may still get it right sometimes by good luck.
not to be taken as an example/not an example to be followed/not to be taken as authoritative
to try to draw a tiger but end up with a likeness of a dog (idiom)/to try to do sth overambitious and end up botching it
cow and famous steed at the same trough (idiom); fig. the common and the great are treated alike
